isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - CONTROLS

svcsubsecinfo.para: The components used to control the lift axle system are covered in this stand-alone section because the configuration of the system controls is independent of the type of lift axle used in the system. This section provides detailed information about the two control configurations used with the lift axle system. For a general understanding of how the controls interact with the rest of the system, refer to the system level information in the SYSTEM DESCRIPTION section .

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The lift axle controls are available in two configurations; however, the same four controls are used in each of the configurations ( FIGURE 24) . The lift axle controls consist of the following:

item.para: an AXLE ENABLE switch (one switch per truck) - to activate the remaining electrical controls of all the lift axles on the truck,
a Lift Axle Up/Down switch (a separate switch for each lift axle) - to raise and lower the indicated lift axle,
a Pressure Regulator control (a separate control for each axle) - to adjust the pressure in the load air springs on the indicated lift axle,
a Pressure Gauge (one gauge per axle for in-cab controls; two gauges per axle for mixed controls) - to indicate the pressure in the load air springs on the indicated lift axle.
